image.altText: A white woman, short blonde hair, wearing glasses, white blazer and blue top. Standing in front of blurred green background

props.synopsis: The NT parliament has passed new laws to restore mandatory minimum sentencing for some domestic violence order breaches, despite widespread disapproval from women's legal services.Â

title.children: Mandatory sentencing reinstated for some DVO breaches in NT

image.altText: A police man smiling surrounded by dry bushland.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the suicide of Northern Territory Constable Michael Deutrom is set to examine the challenges faced by police officers and whether more can be done to support those on the frontline.

title.children: Inquest to examine NT police officer's suicide after 23 years on frontline

image.altText: Close-up shot of man wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The NT government has faced criticism over its move to hand a former gas executive "extraordinary powers" to green-light private development, without publicly recruiting for the "highly-paid" position.

title.children: Closed recruitment of ex-gas boss to 'extraordinary' public job criticised

image.altText: Young girl Camille in bed showing her arms which have wound plasters on her arms.

props.synopsis: Experts say it is the worst year for the soil-born disease in Queensland in around three decades. Meet those who've survived the deadly disease and learn more about what to look out for.

title.children: Three months and 50 tests later, 11yo discovers what made her sick 'by chance'

image.altText: Poster saying 'Wanted by the FBI' with name and mugshot image of Australian man Geoffrey John Busch

props.synopsis: Geoffrey John Busch is wanted over an investment scam in Florida in the early 2000s and just months after a renewed FBI effort to track him down, the ABC found him living in Sydney's southern suburbs.

title.children: Man wanted by FBI found 'living in a family environment' in Sydney

image.altText: A group of teenagers sit together with their backs turned at a high school

props.synopsis: Teenagers and young people are facing new threats that could see their health and wellbeing go backwards, a new Lancet report warns.Â

title.children: Report reveals new health risks faced by first digital native generation

image.altText: Roia Atmar holds a framed photo of her three  young children

props.synopsis: Mother-of-four Roia Atmar says that her husband burned her in a bid to disfigure her so "nobody else would look at me". Researchers say domestic burns violence cases like hers are often under-reported for reasons including fear and shame.

title.children: Domestic violence burns cases 'reasonably common' researchers say

image.altText: women helping

props.synopsis: A group of women in the outback are meeting up over a cuppa to learn how to sew and speak English. Â Â

title.children: Outback sewing classes help migrants learn English and find friendship

image.altText: a childs hand and mothers hands playing with lego blocks

props.synopsis: The NSW government is investing millions into family preservation services to reduce crisis management and keep kids out of foster homes. A mother explains how it worked for her family.

title.children: Family preservation or child protection? For Tara, the answer is clear

image.altText: Will Goodge raises his arms with a banner

props.synopsis: British runner William Goodge broke the record for completing a trans-Australia run by a whopping four days â but there are a handful of people in ultra-running who have questions.Â

title.children: Why 'the fear of the unknown' has some runners questioning this man's record

image.altText: an outside view of a row of houses

props.synopsis:
Many hoped that interest rate cuts could make housing more affordable. But cheaper money for housing, amid a market with high demand and low supply, will keep fuelling property prices.Â 

Â

title.children: 'Impossibly unaffordable': Why property prices in Australia will keep rising

image.altText: RBA sign pictured with stock market graph on top

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is likely to start its day higher following the Reserve Bank's decision to slash interest rates to a two-year low. That move came despite a fall on Wall Street as investors sold their shares in major tech stocks, leading to the S&P 500 snapping its six-day winning streak. Follow live.

title.children: ASX set to rise as markets price in further rate cuts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Markets pricing in at least three more rate cuts
ASX to open higher, despite Wall Street fall

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Xi Jinping composite

props.synopsis: The trip follows a warm letter of congratulations from China's leader following Anthony Albanese's election win.

title.children: Second China visit for Albanese as Xi seeks closer Australia ties

image.altText: A young woman holding out bowls of food to her four children next to some camps at a refugee camp.

props.synopsis: Humanitarian organisations warn it is not enough to tackle the hunger crisis gripping Gaza, as the British government suspends trade talks with Israel over its expanded military offensive in the strip.

title.children: UN warns 14,000 Gazan babies could die in next 48 hours without food

image.altText: Close-up of a white marble statue of a woman with folded hands, carved into a temple pillar

props.synopsis: A community of 750 first-generation migrants has spent a decade fasting daily and raising millions to construct Victoria's first Jain temple, using special methods to honour ancient traditions while meeting modern building codes.

title.children: After a decade of fasting and fundraising a Jain temple takes shape

image.altText: Daniel Mookhey

props.synopsis: With dissent mounting, tensions are set to escalate within caucus and close stakeholders, including the unions.

title.children: NSW workers comp changes dubbed a 'bandaid solution'

image.altText: George Wendt smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: George Wendt, who played the affable, beer-loving bar fly Norm on the hit 1980s comedy Cheers, has died aged 76.

title.children: Cheers star George Wendt dies aged 76

image.altText: Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou holding his chin. thinking, on a football pitch touchline

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou says he has no concerns about his future as Tottenham manager, arguing all his focus is on his side's Europa League final against Manchester United.

title.children: 'I'm not a clown': Defiant Postecoglou puts Spurs first ahead of Europa League final

image.altText: David Littleproud speaks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Liberal National Party says it is "optimistic" an agreement will be reached between the two federal parties in the future.

title.children: Coalition split unlikely to impact Queensland's LNP

image.altText: Murray Watt seated in front of a window, hands clasped, with the back of a head in the foreground.

props.synopsis: New federal Environment Minister Murray Watt is in WA sounding out two big issues, including the potential extension of Woodside's North West Shelf. But his big task is to avoid upsetting a man used to getting his way.

title.children: As two headaches confront new environment minister in WA, a third looms

image.altText: Empty 'next service' screens at Parramatta Station amid massive train delays

props.synopsis: Sydney Trains are working to get six tracks operational on the network after a heavy rail collided with overhead wires near Strathfield on Tuesday afternoon. Follow live.

title.children: Power back on Sydney train network but 'significant' delays continue

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Train staff 'unable to travel' to work
All hands on deck at the command centre

image.altText: A 1930s Sepia photo of six men in civilian clothes standing on the deck of a ship.

props.synopsis: When one side of the Spanish Civil War asked the world for help, a small band of Australian men and women answered the call.

title.children: Australia told these people not to go to war. They went anyway

image.altText: Three men in suits shaking hands and holding blue reports in their hands.

props.synopsis: The freshly announced commission of inquiry into child safety will be the third such government funded investigation since 2003. So what's going to be different this time around?

title.children: Queensland's child safety system is like watching a horror movie on repeat

image.altText: A Carlton captain hands over the ball to a club great wearing a suit, as both men shake hands after a game.

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago today, suburban VFL/AFL men's footy in Melbourne came to an end. On the anniversary of Carlton vs Melbourne at Princes Park, we talk to Anthony Koutoufides and others, looking back at the memories from suburban grounds, and how the game has changed.Â

title.children: 'It was hard to accept': The day the AFL said goodbye to suburban footy

image.altText: a sign on the side of a rugby league pitch calling for good behaviour

props.synopsis: Players and parents are being warned action will be taken if referees continue to face threats of violence, as one league reveals a junior referee had to be escorted to their car due to threatening behaviour.

title.children: âAppallingâ behaviour derails junior rugby league season

image.altText: Jay Vine cycles through the streets of Italy

props.synopsis: A trio of Australians reach the top 10 in the 10th stage of the Giro d'Italia, but none are as quick as Dutch winner Daan Hoole.

title.children: Untimely puncture thwarts Aussie Vine in Giro d'Italia's 10th stage

image.altText: Four young models pose in black outfits in front of a brick wall

props.synopsis: After the shock departure of New York based IMG from Australian Fashion Week last year, the annual industry event is tailoring things to better suit the local industry. But not everyone is happy about it.

title.children: Australian Fashion Week has new owners, and it's becoming more exclusive

image.altText: a photo of a horse standing in the woods

props.synopsis: The fourth Kosciuszko National Park wild horse survey within five years is now estimating that less than 6,000 remain as of 2024 after "large efforts" to reduce numbers.

title.children: Parks service to focus on feral horse reproduction as population drops

image.altText: Alev Kelter looks down at an Australian player while a teammate gestures to her to calm down

props.synopsis: A disciplinary committee bans US women's rugby star Alev Kelter for three games for stomping on Wallaroos centre Georgina Friedrichs's head.

title.children: American handed three-game ban for stamping on Wallaroo's head

image.altText: A man in a blue suit waives to people out of shot while walking in front of photographers

props.synopsis: Lai Ching-te marked one year in office by extending an olive branch to Beijing, while also calling on the island to keep bolstering its defences.

title.children: Taiwan's leader has called for dialogue and peace with China. Beijing isn't interested

image.altText: AFL player Jeremy Mcgovern looks downcast with a bandage around his head.

props.synopsis: The playing future of West Coast Eagles great Jeremy McGovern is in doubt, after the club revealed he will consult the AFL's concussion panel after "ongoing symptoms" following a knock against Melbourne on May 3.Â

title.children: Concussion casts shadow on playing future of Eagles great McGovern

image.altText: A large metal silo on a farm at sunset. One side has been replaced with glass windows and inside is accommodation.

props.synopsis: Old silos that were once used for storing food are undergoing glamorous transformations to become luxury accommodation, providing new income streams for farmers.Â

title.children: It wasn't cheap, but these old silos have been transformed into luxury
